senses.de: A person who buys goods or services from a shop or business
senses.ex: The store provides discounts to regular customers.

Tips.title: Purchasing Power
Tips.description: Understand 'customer' implies the power to choose where to buy.
Tips.example: As a customer, you have the right to return defective products.

Tips.title: Regular Visits
Tips.description: 'Customer' often refers to someone who shops repeatedly at the same place.
Tips.example: The coffee shop has many customers who come in daily.

Tips.title: Impersonal Label
Tips.description: The term doesn't imply a personal relationship, unlike 'client'.
Tips.example: Supermarkets have thousands of customers they don't know personally.

senses.de: A person or organization that uses a service
senses.ex: Our software is user-friendly and thus preferred by many customers.

Tips.title: Service Use
Tips.description: Highlights usage rather than buying; applicable to free services.
Tips.example: Even though our app is free, all users are considered customers.

Tips.title: Beyond Shopping
Tips.description: 'Customer' can refer to recipients of various types of services.
Tips.example: As an accountant, I provide financial advice to my customers.

Tips.title: Technology Context
Tips.description: Often used in tech to describe users of software or online services.
Tips.example: Our customers can access all features on our website.

senses.de: A person whose behavior is difficult to deal with
senses.ex: Bob can be a difficult customer when he's angry.

Tips.title: Behavioral Aspect
Tips.description: Describes someone who might cause trouble or be hard to satisfy.
Tips.example: That customer keeps sending back his food, complaining it's not cooked well.

Tips.title: Demanding Nature
Tips.description: Can be used to warn about someone with high or specific demands.
Tips.example: Prepare your best work; we're dealing with a very demanding customer today.

Buy.wordDefinition:
Buy refers to the act of purchasing a product or service. It is applicable when a person pays a certain amount of money in exchange for an item or service.

Customer refers to a person who purchases a product or service from a business. It is applicable to the person who is buying the product or service and engaging with the business.

Buy is the action of purchasing something, while a customer is the person making the purchase.

Client.wordDefinition:
Both words client and customer refer to people who buy goods or services.

A client is someone who has an ongoing business relationship with a company or individual. This relationship can be based on a contract, agreement or retainer.

For example, if a lawyer represents you in a legal matter, you are their client.

The main difference between a customer and a client is the duration and purpose of the relationship.

A customer typically engages with a business on a transactional and infrequent basis, while a client has a sustained and ongoing relationship with a business or individual.

Consumer.wordDefinition:
Consumer refers to a person who uses a product or service. They may or may not have paid for it. Customer refers to a person who has bought a product or service from a business.

For example, if someone goes to a grocery store and picks up a can of soda, they are a consumer of the soda. If they go to a restaurant and order a meal, they are a customer of the restaurant because they have paid for the meal.

The terms are interchangeable in some situations, but generally, consumer is used more broadly to refer to anyone who uses a product or service, while customer specifically refers to someone who has made a purchase or transaction with a business.

Guest.wordDefinition:
Guest is used in the context of hospitality where people are welcomed and treated as visitors. For example, a person staying in a hotel or attending a wedding is called a guest.

Customer pertains to a person who pays for a product or service, while guest refers to a person who is welcomed and accommodated by a host.

Patron.wordDefinition:
A patron is someone who supports and regularly visits a particular establishment, such as a restaurant or theater.

Customers are typically only focused on transactions and purchasing products or services, whereas patrons are more invested in the overall experience and have a loyalty or connection to the establishment.

The term customer is used in a wider range of businesses, while patron is more commonly used in the context of arts and entertainment.

Purchaser.wordDefinition:
A purchaser is someone who specifically buys something from a business. They have made a payment for something and are the owner of that product.

Both terms are applicable in business, but they describe different aspects of the buying process. The term customer is used more broadly to describe anyone who interacts with a business, while purchaser is used specifically to describe someone who has bought something.

Shop.wordDefinition:
Shop can refer to either a physical retail store or the act of browsing for goods to purchase. It's applicable when a person is looking for something to buy, whether it's in a brick-and-mortar store or online.

So, in summary: customer describes the person making a purchase, while shop describes the place or activity where a purchase is made.

User.wordDefinition:
User refers to someone who uses a product or service, whether they paid for it or not. They may be using it for free or as part of a subscription or membership, but they are not necessarily paying for it directly.

In business, the term customer is often used in relation to sales and marketing, while user is more commonly used in relation to product development and design.
